UnitType.Description: Pioneers are equipped with the necessary supplies to start new settlements and create outposts.
UnitType.Backstory: "I seek no mercenaries; the Silver Swordsmen and their ilk are unwelcome in the ranks of my army. What I seek are heroes - those who wish to make bettering this world their life's adventure!" These words - uttered at the nadir of the Nobles Revolt, when the armies of Procipinee surrounded Relias and his companions at the foot of Mount Essa - remain the rallying cry for all Altar's soldiers. This is an army of adventurers - many of whom are famous in their own right for the quests they have completed - an army that will sometimes dare the impossible and often achieve it.

UnitType.Description: Use scouts to explore the world.

UnitType.Description: Pioneers are equipped with the necessary supplies to start new settlements and create outposts.
UnitType.Backstory: All who wear the colors of this army, from commander to common foot-soldier, can trace their lineage back to the great kingdoms of the pre-cataclysmic era - to Coriopolis, Zad-Zabril, and even fabled Antheros. The blood of the channelers of old runs in their veins; they know and are unafraid of using this power to aid them in combat, both as shield and sword, in defense and attack. The commander who would engage this army in battle most possess a similar familiarity with the enchanter's art.

The commander who would engage this army in battle most possess a similar familiarity with the enchanter's art.

UnitType.Description: Pioneers are equipped with the necessary supplies to start new settlements and create outposts.
UnitType.Backstory: These are miners by trade; they make cautious soldiers, content to assess a battle's progress from a fortified position, to rely less on tactical skill and more on superior equipment to provide them advantage. Many among them are innately resistant to the channeler's basic spells, a trait inherited from the greatest of their kind, Fierann Ma Tua of the Aivernach.

UnitType.Description: Pioneers are equipped with the necessary supplies to start new settlements and create outposts.
UnitType.Backstory: The armies of Capitar have at their disposal the vast wealth of the great trading houses of old, money that lets them buy not just the best equipment, but the best fighters: mercenaries such as the Silver Swordsmen; archers whose skills rival the ninety-nine of Redstone; war horses bred from the stock of fabled Antheros. This great wealth buys influence in diplomatic councils as well as on the battlefield; a fact the seasoned commander would do well to keep in mind when forging alliances.

UnitType.Description: Use scouts to explore the world.

UnitType.Description: Pioneers are equipped with the necessary supplies to start new settlements and create outposts.
UnitType.Backstory: Once they were rebels; slaves fighting to shake off the chains of the Capitaran arenas. Now they are an army - brave and determined soldiers with a country of their own to defend. Yet by training and nature Tarthans remain gladiators - used to fighting alone, or in small groups. They will strike quickly, and retreat, never allowing themselves to get bogged down in a long, drawn-out conflict. Their commanders drill them constantly on all types of terrain, so that in combat they may move as quickly in swamp as on packed earth.

UnitType.Description: Use scouts to explore the world.

They will strike quickly, and retreat, never allowing themselves to get bogged down in a long, drawn-out conflict. Their commanders drill them constantly on all types of terrain, so that in combat they may move as quickly in swamp as on packed earth.

Yet by training and nature Tarthans remain gladiators - used to fighting alone, or in small groups. They will strike quickly, and retreat, never allowing themselves to get bogged down in a long, drawn-out conflict. Their commanders drill them constantly on all types of terrain, so that in combat they may move as quickly in swamp as on packed earth.

Once they were rebels; slaves fighting to shake off the chains of the Capitaran arenas. Now they are an army - brave and determined soldiers with a country of their own to defend. They will strike quickly, and retreat, never allowing themselves to get bogged down in a long, drawn-out conflict. Their commanders drill them constantly on all types of terrain, so that in combat they may move as quickly in swamp as on packed earth.
